title: A35JT Tonga Expedition
synopsis: The DX Expedition in affiliation with IOTA, Islands on the Air, had a presence on the band in that so many stations were calling it. Here the infrequent acknowledgements suggest they were operating  [[Concurrent Contacts]] and would not wait for these transmissions. [https://vk5gr-iota.net site]

title: Advanced D3 Technique
synopsis: It has been a few years since cracking the code for d3 technique. It is coming back slowly. First, be sure anything you read online is for v5 which we have chosen to use. Then use each example as a guide through the docs before trying any part in code you want to work.

title: Aperture Effects
synopsis: We count events to quantify the activity reported from digital ham radio receivers. We find ourselves trading off statistical properties for temporal resolution.

title: BL
synopsis: - BL09 [http://www.levinecentral.com/ham/grid_square.php?Grid=BL09 map]

title: BP
synopsis: - BP09 [http://www.levinecentral.com/ham/grid_square.php?Grid=BP09 map]

title: Broadband Radio System
synopsis: We're assembling a digital radio from large modules from open-source hardware and software.

title: CM
synopsis: - CM09 [http://www.levinecentral.com/ham/grid_square.php?Grid=CM09 map]

title: CN
synopsis: - CN09 [http://www.levinecentral.com/ham/grid_square.php?Grid=CN09 map]

title: Concurrent Contacts
synopsis: Contact rates as high as 500 per hour can be achieved using the exceptional spectral and temporal control offered by digital radio. [http://physics.princeton.edu/pulsar/k1jt/FT8_DXpedition_Mode.pdf pdf]

title: Connetions on 3.5 MHz
synopsis: These stations were recorded over an interval of 9.6 minutes. See [[Spark Decodes]]

title: Decode Waterfall
synopsis: We prototype a waterfall display reconstructed from decoded data and rendered with d3. This shows digital ham radio activity at 14 MHz that depends on daytime ionospheric skip. [http://found.ward.bay.wiki.org/assets/pages/k9ox-ft8-log/waterfall.html?offset=-1331 chart] [https://github.com/WardCunningham/assets/blob/master/pages/k9ox-ft8-log/waterfall.html github]

title: Diagram Status Block
synopsis: We experiment here to decide how we might format status information in our social network diagrams.

title: Digital Exchanges Explained
synopsis: The highly efficient digital radio protocol called FT8 gets much of its efficiency by limiting in messages what can be said and when. Still within this framework exists sufficient latitude for humans to engage in a collective activity a bit like trading stamps.

title: DM
synopsis: - DM09 Reno, Nevada

title: DN
synopsis: - DN09 [http://www.levinecentral.com/ham/grid_square.php?Grid=DN09 map]

title: Earth from Space
synopsis: We could find some use for a globe coded in three.js and shared on github. Includes a walkthrough of the construction. [https://blog.mastermaps.com/2013/09/creating-webgl-earth-with-threejs.html post] [https://github.com/turban/webgl-earth github] [http://thematicmapping.org/playground/webgl/earth/ enlarge]

title: EL
synopsis: - EL09 San Antonio, Texas

title: EM
synopsis: - EM09 [http://www.levinecentral.com/ham/grid_square.php?Grid=EM09 map]

title: EN
synopsis: - EN09 [http://www.levinecentral.com/ham/grid_square.php?Grid=EN09 map]

title: Federation Search
synopsis: Search the visible federation for pages matching all words entered. Case doesn't matter but spelling does.

title: First Look at Exchanges
synopsis: When I tried to explain an FT8 exchange to colleagues I got the idea that I should unravel some as I hear them and make a web page of them. I got the unraveling done that evening. Here I take a first look the next morning.

title: FM
synopsis: - FM09 [http://www.levinecentral.com/ham/grid_square.php?Grid=FM09 map]

title: FN
synopsis: - FN09 [http://www.levinecentral.com/ham/grid_square.php?Grid=FN09 map]

title: FT8 at K9OX
synopsis: New digital modes appear in amateur radio with software downloads and a sound card connection to a suitable laptop computer. FT8 is the new thing logging at least 10x more contacts than any other, or perhaps all other modes combined. [https://www.flexradio.com/ft8-tipping-point-for-ham-radio/ post]

title: FT8 Plots and Diagrams
synopsis: We collect decodes from various locations and display them various ways. Here we pull these together to find each quickly.

title: Ham Radio Operations
synopsis: We've been operating ham radio station K9OX once again after maybe a decade of inactivity. [http://ft8.ward.asia.wiki.org/assets/pages/ham-radio-operations/k90x-digital-radio.jpg expand]

title: Hermes-Lite 2 Hardware
synopsis: The Hermes-Lite is a low-cost direct down/up conversion software defined amateur radio HF transceiver based on a broadband modem chip and the Hermes SDR project. It is entirely open source and open hardware, including the tools used for design and fabrication files. Over 300 Hermes-Lite 2.0 units have been successfully built.

title: Hermes-Lite SDR Transceiver
synopsis: The Hermes-Lite is an outstanding low-cost direct down/up conversion software defined amateur radio HF transceiver based on a broadband modem chip and the Hermes SDR project. [https://www.sdr-radio.com/hermes-lite-2-hl2 post] [http://www.hermeslite.com/ site]  [https://github.com/softerhardware/Hermes-Lite2/wiki wiki] [https://lirp-cdn.multiscreensite.com/46d0be53/dms3rep/multi/opt/IMG_3072-1920w.JPG enlarge]

title: HTML Scripts
synopsis: We write scripts in html to be run alone in their own tab or in a wiki Frame where they can add pages to the lineup. We save these in a repo and upload the versions we want to a wiki asset folder.

title: JA0QVJ on 18.1 MHz
synopsis: These acknowldgements were recorded over 8.5 minutes starting with JA0QVJ at 11/27/2020, 1:24:04 PM.

title: JA8GMH on 21.0 MHz
synopsis: These acknowldgements were recorded over 46.4 minutes starting with JA8GMH at 11/26/2020, 4:18:46 PM.

title: Joe Taylor Fan Club
synopsis: Joseph Hooton Taylor Jr. (born March 29, 1941) is an American astrophysicist and Nobel Prize in Physics laureate for his discovery with Russell Alan Hulse of a "new type of pulsar, a discovery that has opened up new possibilities for the study of gravitation." [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Hooton_Taylor_Jr. wikipedia]

title: K2GT Efficient Operation
synopsis: We see a single station dominating our connection diagram and investigate his operating practice.

title: KO4DDK on 21.0 MHz
synopsis: These acknowldgements were recorded over 15.0 minutes starting with KO4DDK at 11/28/2020, 9:18:58 AM.

title: KP3H Efficient Operation
synopsis: Our social network diagram brings another exceptional operator to our attention.

title: Logbook of The World
synopsis: Logbook of the World is a web-accessed database provided by the American Radio Relay League to implement a contact verification service among amateur radio operators. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logbook_of_The_World wikipedia] [https://www.rickmurphy.net/trustedqsl.org/tQSL-documents/lotwspec.pdf pdf]

title: Madenhead CN85
synopsis: See [[Missing Grid Squares]]

title: Making the Exchange Script
synopsis: After a conversation less than two days ago I've taken an idea and turned it into a script with output I rather like. Now seems a good time to reflect on decisions made along the way. [https://github.com/WardCunningham/assets/blob/eb784879b96a86fbc17d948b330260b96869bb7d/pages/spark-decodes/exchange.html github]

title: Missing Grid Squares
synopsis: <center><table>

title: N7TMS on 7.0 MHz
synopsis: These acknowldgements were recorded over 32.0 minutes starting with N7TMS at 11/19/2020, 9:15:12 AM. See [[Spark Decodes]]

title: Overnight Opening
synopsis: Datalog recordings report continuous activity Oct 16-17. What's with that? Select All from WSJT-X shows otherwise.

title: Radio's Social Network
synopsis: We look at recent radio traffic and draw associations based on who has confirmed contacts. [http://ward.asia.wiki.org/assets/pages/radios-social-network/view.html enlarge] [https://github.com/WardCunningham/ft8-network github]

title: Share the Wonder
synopsis: Jeri Ellsworth's Tilt Five suggests we can, "Explore, battle, and solve puzzles together with friends as your game unfolds in a shared holographic space, whether they’re across the table or across the world." [https://www.tiltfive.com/ site]

title: Signals on 14.0 MHz
synopsis: These stations were recorded over an interval of 12.53 minutes. See [[Spark Decodes]]

title: Signals on 21.0 MHz
synopsis: These stations were recorded over an interval of 2.49 minutes. See [[Spark Decodes]]

title: Spark Band History
synopsis: We watch activity move from band to band following changes in daytime and nighttime propagation. Here we look over a period of many days.

title: Spark Decodes
synopsis: We're using SparkSDR  V2.0.3.8 talking to Hermes-Lite 2 and listening to decodes on a WebSocket. [http://www.ihopper.org/radio/sparksdr2.htm site]

title: Spark Script Tools
synopsis: HTML and Javascript work together to make an interesting graphical environment. Here are some we use rendering [[Spark Decodes]] in various forms.

title: Spark Signals
synopsis: We observe [[Spark Decodes]] and report signal strength on a station by station basis. We average over multiple receptions and contrast that to distance traveled.

title: Spark Social Spreading
synopsis: We show stations in contact with each other as if they are passing messages or spreading a disease. Choose one.

title: SparkSDR Application
synopsis: Software for Hermes Lite and openHPSDR radios. [http://www.ihopper.org/radio/ site]

title: Tag Propagation
synopsis: We identify some stations as tagged and once tagged all stations they confirm will hence be marked as tagged too.

title: Three.js Fundamentals
synopsis: This is the first article in a series of articles about three.js. Three.js is a 3D library that tries to make it as easy as possible to get 3D content on a webpage.

title: Transmission Sequences
synopsis: We examine the usual exchange of information and variations that might be interesting in decode datasets.

title: UDP Reporting and Requests
synopsis: The WSJT-X ham radio digital signaling application will report decoding status and accept requests by UDP datagrams. Here we explore how to avail ourselves of that service. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User_Datagram_Protocol wikipedia]

title: US Cities by Grid Square
synopsis: We identify grid squares that contain a large city. These make up 133 of the 314 largest cities.

title: VA7QI on 10.1 MHz
synopsis: These acknowldgements were recorded over 19.9 minutes starting with VA7QI at 11/19/2020, 9:12:57 AM. See [[Spark Decodes]]

title: VE7ON on 10.1 MHz
synopsis: These acknowldgements were recorded over 16.7 minutes starting with VE7ON at 11/27/2020, 9:31:12 AM.

title: W3KM on 14.0 MHz
synopsis: These acknowldgements were recorded over 0.8 minutes starting with W3KM at 12/2/2020, 10:25:35 AM.

title: Ward Cunningham
synopsis: I've operated a ham radio station off and on since college in the late '60s. I've also written radio related programs and even published an early one in QST.

title: Waterfall Decorations
synopsis: We imagine interacting with a [[Decode Waterfall]] as an open testbed for interaction mechanisms, some easily simulated in 2d, others unique to the TiltFive hardware.

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site. From this page you can find who we are and what we do. New sites provide this information and then claim the site as their own. You will need your own site to participate.

title: WH6S on 18.1 MHz
synopsis: These acknowldgements were recorded over 26.2 minutes starting with WH6S at 11/19/2020, 3:50:48 PM. See [[Spark Decodes]]

title: WSJT-X
synopsis: WSJT-X is a computer program designed to facilitate basic amateur radio communication using very weak signals. The first four letters in the program name stand for “Weak Signal communication by K1JT,” while the suffix “-X” indicates that WSJT-X started as an extended and experimental branch of the program WSJT. [https://physics.princeton.edu/pulsar/k1jt/wsjtx-doc/wsjtx-main-2.0.1.html site]

title: K9OX FT8 Log
synopsis: The WSJT-X application creates a variety of logs. Here we upload the log kept in ADIF format for use elsewhere.
